intro: Phaulopsis parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered phaulopsis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
